result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/15/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Ortiz

records.addlTxt: Judgment for Unpaid Fines addressed to: Daniel Ortiz Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel Ortiz
Current: Unknown,   (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: 3381 N. 26th St., Milwaukee, WI 53206
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

1:56 PM Defendant Daniel Ortiz not in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Daniel Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Jayne Davis Dewire in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Griffins states that the Defendant is having transportation issues and is willing to take the State's offer and request to pass the case until 3 pm.
Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date. 

The Court recalls the matter at 03:20 pm with the following appearances:
Defendant Daniel Ortiz in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Daniel Ortiz.  Prosecuting attorney Jayne Davis Dewire in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court quashes the warrant.
The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 1.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.


Court orders the following:
	
Fine:  $316.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  Defendant to pay $50.00 per month commencing September 15, 2022 and each month thereafter until satisfied.  Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

HOW TO PAY:
Payments can be made on-line with a MasterCard or electronic check at:  http://wcca.wicourts.gov  (Read the agreement, then click "I agree," then click "Pay fees on-line.")  OR you may contact the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts Business Center at 262-548-7497.
Pre-trial conference on August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:16 PM Attorney Justin G Griffis in court.   Defendant Daniel Ortiz did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Griffis presents statements as to his client's non appearance and requests a date after August 16, 2022.
The State does not object.
The Court will adjourn.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

08:37 AM Defendant Daniel Ortiz appeared by Zoom with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Check Case scheduled for April 29, 2022.
